newsitem.title: GERMANY: D.Telekom invests in two Philippines firms.
newsitem.headline: D.Telekom invests in two Philippines firms.

text.p: Germany's Deutsche Telekom AG said on Tuesday it had bought stakes in two telecommunications companies in the Philippines, sealing an earlier agreement during a visit to the country by Chancellor Helmut Kohl.
Telekom said in a statement it had bought a 10 percent stake in Islacom, as well as a 40 percent stake in Asiacom Philippines, which has a controlling holding in Islacom.
Islacom runs the Philippines' two mobile phone networks and has a licence to build a fixed-line network in the Visayas, a part of the Philippines with above-average growth.
The investment adds to Telekom's interests in Asia, where it is already present in Japan, Hong Kong, Singapore, Indonesia, India, China and Malaysia.
State-owned Telekom will is floating 20 percent of its shares in Europe's largest ever initial public offering, which is expected to raise 15 billion marks.
